Creating a New Hive

Native II vaults store each file revision in its entirety (even though the archive file may be compressed). But using hives allows the revisions to be spread over many volumes. If one hive fills up, you can add another without changing any data locations or moving any archive files. When a server configuration has multiple hives, the server adds files to each hive in turn before reusing the first hive's archive path.

StarTeam 2005 or later server configurations automatically have at least one hive (either the default or a custom hive). To increase the amount of available space for a 2005 or later server configuration, you can use the Hive Manager to add a new hive. The hive can be created while the server configuration running, because it already has an initial path, if only to a Default Hive in the repository path. If the original hive was running out of space, you should also use the Hive Manager to display the hive  properties and deselect the "Allow new archives" check box. This action allows the original hive to remain a check-out location, but keeps it from acquiring any new files. Files that are added go to the new hive.

For a server configuration created with StarTeam 6.0 or earlier, Borland recommends that you use the Hive Manager dialog to create a custom hive after installing StarTeam 2005 or StarTeam 2005 Release 2, but before starting the server. Doing this allows you to locate the hive somewhere other than the current repository path, where Default Hive would be placed if you simply started the server.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To create a new hive for a current server configuration:

  1. On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server. The Server Administration dialog appears.

  2. Select a server configuration. If it is a StarTeam 2005 server configuration or later, it may be running or stopped. If it is a server configuration created with StarTeam 6.0 or earlier, it must be stopped. If you have not logged on already, you will be asked to do so.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Hive Manager shortcut in the lower left panel.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Hive Manager.

      • These actions display the Hive Manager dialog, which shows all the hives currently created for the selected server configuration.

  4. Click New. This action displays the New Hive dialog. Note that the location of the hive-index.html file, which contains the properties for each hive used by the server configuration, appears near the top of the screen.

  5. Enter information about the new hive in the following fields:

    • Name: Unique name for the hive. DefaultHive is the default.

    • Archive path: Path to the hive's Archives directory. The default path is <repository_path\DefaultHive\Archives.

    • Cache path: Path to the hive's Cache directory. The default path is <repository_path\DefaultHive\Cache.

    • Maximum cache size: Maximum number of megabytes of hard disk space that the Cache can use. The default is 20% of the disk space available. If you cannot calculate the maximum size, enter 100 MB, which is the default size for a Native-I vault.

    • Cache cleanup interval: Seconds between cache cleanup/refresh operations. The default value is 600. The range is 60 (1 minute) to 3153600 (1 year).

    • Storage limit threshold: Percentage of total disk space allowed for hive. When this percentage has been reached, no more archives can be added to the hive. The default is 95% of the total disk space.

  6. Select or deselect Allow new archives. For a new hive, you will generally want to retain the default, which is selected.  Also, if no other hives exist for the server configuration, this check box must be selected.

  7. (Optional) If you are using StarTeamMPX, set a Root Cache Agent archive path.

  8. Click OK to confirm your choices. This action returns you to the Hive Manager.

  9. Click Close to return to the Server Administration dialog.
